intro: Hibbertia crenata, commonly known as the serrated hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, serrated leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in spring. Hibbertia crenata is often found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal areas. It is a hardy perennial that thrives in full sun and is popular in native gardens.
